+from __future__ import absolute_import
+from __future__ import division
+from __future__ import print_function
+
+from tensorflow.python.ops import nn
+from tensorflow.python.ops import rnn_cell
+from tensorflow.python.ops import variable_scope as vs
+from tensorflow.contrib.learn.python.learn.ops import dropout_ops
+
+
+def autoencoder(tensor_in, hidden_units,
body:
hm, usually auto-encoders are split into encoder and decoder, where decoder is inverse of encoder (for example encoder can be 100, 50, 10 hidden units, decoder - 10, 50, 100). 
It may be make sense to have separate encoder / decoder parts and then have DNNAutoEncoder vs LSTMAutoEncoder vs etc.
